channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Vision-Language Model Fine-Tuning via Simple Parameter-Efficient Modification
item.description: Recent advances in fine-tuning Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have witnessed the success of prompt tuning and adapter tuning, while the classic model fine-tuning on inherent parameters seems to be overlooked.

item.title: Degradation-Guided One-Step Image Super-Resolution with Diffusion Priors
item.description: Diffusion-based image super-resolution (SR) methods have achieved remarkable success by leveraging large pre-trained text-to-image diffusion models as priors.

item.title: Programming Every Example: Lifting Pre-training Data Quality like Experts at Scale
item.description: Large language model pre-training has traditionally relied on human experts to craft heuristics for improving the corpora quality, resulting in numerous rules developed to date.

item.title: Pre-trained Language Models Return Distinguishable Probability Distributions to Unfaithfully Hallucinated Texts
item.description: In this work, we show the pre-trained language models return distinguishable generation probability and uncertainty distribution to unfaithfully hallucinated texts, regardless of their size and structure.

item.title: CodeInsight: A Curated Dataset of Practical Coding Solutions from Stack Overflow
item.description: We introduce a novel dataset tailored for code generation, aimed at aiding developers in common tasks.

item.title: Enhancing Nighttime UAV Tracking with Light Distribution Suppression
item.description: However, the state-of-the-art (SOTA) enhancers for nighttime UAV tracking always neglect the uneven light distribution in low-light images, inevitably leading to excessive enhancement in scenarios with complex illumination.

item.title: ControlCity: A Multimodal Diffusion Model Based Approach for Accurate Geospatial Data Generation and Urban Morphology Analysis
item.description: This study confirms the effectiveness of our approach in generating urban building footprint data and capturing complex city characteristics.

item.title: E-SQL: Direct Schema Linking via Question Enrichment in Text-to-SQL
item.description: In this work, we introduce E-SQL, a novel pipeline specifically designed to address these challenges through direct schema linking and candidate predicate augmentation.

item.title: WasteGAN: Data Augmentation for Robotic Waste Sorting through Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: To tackle this issue, we introduce a data augmentation method based on a novel GAN architecture called wasteGAN.

item.title: EMIT- Event-Based Masked Auto Encoding for Irregular Time Series
item.description: Irregular time series, where data points are recorded at uneven intervals, are prevalent in healthcare settings, such as emergency wards where vital signs and laboratory results are captured at varying times.

item.title: Training Language Models to Win Debates with Self-Play Improves Judge Accuracy
item.description: We test the robustness of debate as a method of scalable oversight by training models to debate with data generated via self-play.

item.title: EventHallusion: Diagnosing Event Hallucinations in Video LLMs
item.description: On the other hand, we also propose a simple yet effective method, called Temporal Contrastive Decoding (TCD), to tackle the hallucination problems of VideoLLMs.

item.title: Progressive Representation Learning for Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: Specifically, PRL-Track is divided into coarse representation learning and fine representation learning.

item.title: PTQ4RIS: Post-Training Quantization for Referring Image Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we first conduct an in-depth analysis of the root causes of performance degradation in RIS model quantization and propose dual-region quantization (DRQ) and reorder-based outlier-retained quantization (RORQ) to address the quantization difficulties in visual and text encoders.

item.title: Statewide Visual Geolocalization in the Wild
item.description: This work presents a method that is able to predict the geolocation of a street-view photo taken in the wild within a state-sized search region by matching against a database of aerial reference imagery.

item.title: BitQ: Tailoring Block Floating Point Precision for Improved DNN Efficiency on Resource-Constrained Devices
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) are powerful for cognitive tasks such as image classification, object detection, and scene segmentation.

item.title: Multi-Robot Informative Path Planning for Efficient Target Mapping using Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We propose a novel deep reinforcement learning approach for multi-robot informative path planning to map targets-of-interest in an unknown 3D environment.

item.title: MorphoSeg: An Uncertainty-Aware Deep Learning Method for Biomedical Segmentation of Complex Cellular Morphologies
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel benchmark dataset of Ntera-2 (NT2) cells, a pluripotent carcinoma cell line, exhibiting diverse morphologies across multiple stages of differentiation, capturing the intricate and heterogeneous cellular structures that complicate segmentation tasks.

item.title: Classification of Gleason Grading in Prostate Cancer Histopathology Images Using Deep Learning Techniques: YOLO, Vision Transformers, and Vision Mamba
item.description: Vision Mamba emerges as the most effective model for Gleason grade classification in histopathology images, offering a balance between accuracy and computational efficiency.

item.title: CaBRNet, an open-source library for developing and evaluating Case-Based Reasoning Models
item.description: In the field of explainable AI, a vibrant effort is dedicated to the design of self-explainable models, as a more principled alternative to post-hoc methods that attempt to explain the decisions after a model opaquely makes them.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Cognitive State Classification from Speech with Multi-View Pseudo-Labeling
item.description: The lack of labeled data is a common challenge in speech classification tasks, particularly those requiring extensive subjective assessment, such as cognitive state classification.

item.title: Spacewalker: Traversing Representation Spaces for Fast Interactive Exploration and Annotation of Unstructured Data
item.description: Unstructured data in industries such as healthcare, finance, and manufacturing presents significant challenges for efficient analysis and decision making.

item.title: DALDA: Data Augmentation Leveraging Diffusion Model and LLM with Adaptive Guidance Scaling
item.description: In this paper, we present an effective data augmentation framework leveraging the Large Language Model (LLM) and Diffusion Model (DM) to tackle the challenges inherent in data-scarce scenarios.

item.title: TSBP: Improving Object Detection in Histology Images via Test-time Self-guided Bounding-box Propagation
item.description: Because of this, using a preset global threshold (e. g., 0. 5) applied to all the bounding box candidates may lead to suboptimal solutions.

item.title: VPTQ: Extreme Low-bit Vector Post-Training Quantization for Large Language Models
item.description: Due to the redundancy in LLM weights, recent research has focused on pushing weight-only quantization to extremely low-bit (even down to 2 bits).

item.title: Cross-lingual Speech Emotion Recognition: Humans vs. Self-Supervised Models
item.description: Utilizing Self-Supervised Learning (SSL) models for Speech Emotion Recognition (SER) has proven effective, yet limited research has explored cross-lingual scenarios.

item.title: Generative Object Insertion in Gaussian Splatting with a Multi-View Diffusion Model
item.description: Generating and inserting new objects into 3D content is a compelling approach for achieving versatile scene recreation.

item.title: Claim-Guided Textual Backdoor Attack for Practical Applications
item.description: Recent advances in natural language processing and the increased use of large language models have exposed new security vulnerabilities, such as backdoor attacks.

item.title: MaViLS, a Benchmark Dataset for Video-to-Slide Alignment, Assessing Baseline Accuracy with a Multimodal Alignment Algorithm Leveraging Speech, OCR, and Visual Features
item.description: This paper presents a benchmark dataset for aligning lecture videos with corresponding slides and introduces a novel multimodal algorithm leveraging features from speech, text, and images.

item.title: Zero-Shot Detection of LLM-Generated Text using Token Cohesiveness
item.description: In this paper, we identify a new feature, token cohesiveness, that is useful for zero-shot detection, and we demonstrate that LLM-generated text tends to exhibit higher token cohesiveness than human-written text.

item.title: Prompt Sliders for Fine-Grained Control, Editing and Erasing of Concepts in Diffusion Models
item.description: Concept Sliders introduced a method for fine-grained image control and editing by learning concepts (attributes/objects).

item.title: SDCL: Students Discrepancy-Informed Correction Learning for Semi-supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised medical image segmentation (SSMIS) has been demonstrated the potential to mitigate the issue of limited medical labeled data.

item.title: Attention Prompting on Image for Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: To fill this gap, in this work, we propose a new prompting technique named Attention Prompting on Image, which just simply overlays a text-query-guided attention heatmap on the original input image and effectively enhances LVLM on various tasks.

item.title: Demystifying Issues, Causes and Solutions in LLM Open-Source Projects
item.description: With the advancements of Large Language Models (LLMs), an increasing number of open-source software projects are using LLMs as their core functional component.

item.title: Tiny Robotics Dataset and Benchmark for Continual Object Detection
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel benchmark to evaluate the continual learning capabilities of object detection systems in tiny robotic platforms.

item.title: MOSS: Enabling Code-Driven Evolution and Context Management for AI Agents
item.description: MOSS ensures consistency and adaptability by using a mechanism that maintains the Python context across interactions, including isolation of local variables and preservation of runtime integrity.

item.title: Aided design of bridge aesthetics based on Stable Diffusion fine-tuning
item.description: Stable Diffusion fine-tuning technique is tried to assist bridge-type innovation.

item.title: A Zero-Shot Open-Vocabulary Pipeline for Dialogue Understanding
item.description: Dialogue State Tracking (DST) is crucial for understanding user needs and executing appro- priate system actions in task-oriented dialogues.

item.title: HelloBench: Evaluating Long Text Generation Capabilities of Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, we introduce the Hierarchical Long Text Generation Benchmark (HelloBench), a comprehensive, in-the-wild, and open-ended benchmark to evaluate LLMs' performance in generating long text.

item.title: DataGpt-SQL-7B: An Open-Source Language Model for Text-to-SQL
item.description: In addressing the pivotal role of translating natural language queries into SQL commands, we propose a suite of compact, fine-tuned models and self-refine mechanisms to democratize data access and analysis for non-expert users, mitigating risks associated with closed-source Large Language Models.

item.title: LTNtorch: PyTorch Implementation of Logic Tensor Networks
item.description: This makes learning by logical reasoning possible as the parameters of the model are optimized by minimizing a loss function composed of a set of logical formulas expressing facts about the learning task.

item.title: Privacy Evaluation Benchmarks for NLP Models
item.description: In this paper, we present a privacy attack and defense evaluation benchmark in the field of NLP, which includes the conventional/small models and large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Stage-Wise Reward Shaping for Acrobatic Robots: A Constrained Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning Approach
item.description: As the complexity of tasks addressed through reinforcement learning (RL) increases, the definition of reward functions also has become highly complicated.

item.title: Self-supervised Shape Completion via Involution and Implicit Correspondences
item.description: 3D shape completion is traditionally solved using supervised training or by distribution learning on complete shape examples.

item.title: EnIGMA: Enhanced Interactive Generative Model Agent for CTF Challenges
item.description: Although language model (LM) agents are demonstrating growing potential in many domains, their success in cybersecurity has been limited due to simplistic design and the lack of fundamental features for this domain.

item.title: CHBench: A Chinese Dataset for Evaluating Health in Large Language Models
item.description: With the rapid development of large language models (LLMs), assessing their performance on health-related inquiries has become increasingly essential.

item.title: XTRUST: On the Multilingual Trustworthiness of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities across a range of natural language processing (NLP) tasks, capturing the attention of both practitioners and the broader public.

item.title: In-Context Ensemble Improves Video-Language Models for Low-Level Workflow Understanding from Human Demonstrations
item.description: We explore in-context learning with video-language models for SOP generation.

item.title: iGAiVA: Integrated Generative AI and Visual Analytics in a Machine Learning Workflow for Text Classification
item.description: In developing machine learning (ML) models for text classification, one common challenge is that the collected data is often not ideally distributed, especially when new classes are introduced in response to changes of data and tasks.

item.title: CDChat: A Large Multimodal Model for Remote Sensing Change Description
item.description: In order to achieve this, we introduce a change description instruction dataset that can be utilized to finetune an LMM and provide better change descriptions for RS images.
